fields.description:
Confluence workbox (tasks and notifications) does not load in IE8. See reports on Atlassian Answers:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/84467/confluence-4-3-tasks-notifications-do-not-load

And also on the Confluence 4.3.1 release notes:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+4.3.1+Release+Notes?focusedCommentId=302809497#comment-302809497

!https://img.skitch.com/20120918-bg69g9u1fn4kmnb94skg7cq96j.png!

h3.Workaround
Disable Compatibility Mode on IE8. But if that is not possible, then edit both {{templates\mywork.vm}} as well as {{templates\login.vm}} in the *mywork-confluence-host-plugin-x.x.x.jar* (which is stored in the {{confluence\WEB-INF\classes\com\atlassian\confluence\setup\bundled-plugins.zip}}).

Add this:
{code}
<meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=EDGE,chrome=IE7">
{code}
in between the {{<head>}} {{</head>}} tags. It should look like this:
*mywork.vm*
{code}
<head>
    <title>${i18n.getText("com.atlassian.mywork.title")}</title>

    <!-- Need to add media query support for IE8-->
	<meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=EDGE,chrome=IE7">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0, user-scalable=no">
    <meta name="context-path" content="${req.contextPath}">
{code}

*login.vm*:
{code}
<head>
    <title>${i18n.getText("com.atlassian.mywork.login.title")}</title>
	<meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=EDGE,chrome=IE7">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
{code}

Refer to [Edit Confluence JAR files|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=103711179] for more info on how to edit the JAR files. Best method is to use WinRAR, edit the files from within WinRAR, and update the archive after that

*Problem Description*
When user tried to click on medium size image on Chrome in Windows Seven and Confluence 4.3, the page editor will somehow behave that the image want to be moved. This issue do not persist in Firefox and less reproducible in Unix based operating system. 

*Steps to replicate*
# Create a page without any layout in Confluence using any browser.
# Include some 10 random images of average size about 400px to 700px tall, 1 image per line.
# So you form a page full of images in a straight line.
!chrome-editor-bug.png!
# Save the page.
# Re-edit the page using Google Chrome.
# In the editor, click any single image, and notice the weird behavior of Chrome thinking you are trying to drag and drop the images.
# To reproduce this problem, scroll down while still in the editor, click on any image.

*Workaround*
Currently the only workaround available is to use other web browser, such as Firefox that is not affected by this issue.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26631].
  {panel}

Sometimes, an applied "Effect" for an inserted image no longer shows in the WYSIWYG.

To replicate the problem:

1. Edit a page, insert an image, choose an Effect, add a caption to it.
2. Save the page.
3. Edit the page again: for the same image as above, click on Caption again, change the caption text around a little bit (text and positioning), then lock in that change against the image.

--> In the resulting WYSIWYG display (even before the Save), you will no longer see the applied Effect of the image.

You can now click on the image and apply the Effect again, but in the modal window, you will see that the effect is actually still applied. When you click on it again, and commit the change, it now shows again.

For any questions, please just get in touch with me.
fields.summary: Display problem of "Effects" against inserted images in the WYSIWYG

fields.description:
*Problem Description*
Recently Updated Dashboard macro in Confluence 4.3 doesn't adapt language other than English. It was working in Confluence 4.2.8 and 4.2.12. It might be a bug with Confluence Dashboard Macro plugin in Confluence 4.3.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Install Confluence 4.3
# Change the language to for example German
# Change the browser language to change Confluence language
# Navigate to Confluence dashboard
# You will see that the Recently updated dashboard macro tab on the right doesn't adapt the newly configured language

*Workaround*
# Navigate to {{<confluence-install>/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/setup}} in Confluence 4.3
# Delete {{confluence-dashboard-macros-4.3.jar}}
# Replace the file with confluence-dashboard-macros-4.2.8.jar or {{confluence-dashboard-macros-4.2.12}}
# Restart Confluence
fields.summary: Recently Updated Dashboard macro in Confluence 4.3 doesn't adapt language other than English

## Now you are *getting frustrated*, and you put your cursor *end of* "*This button, will make you rich*" bullet and press *Enter* 3 times. It will *separate* the bullet-ed list from the numbered list. But yeah.. you can always "*fix*" this by *removing* the extra line so no biggie.. But then you *select* the "*b. Configuration*" numbered list and *BOOM!!* the extra line is there *again*?
## *By now* you are a bit giddy about the whole thing, but at the same time a bit angry/sad. You think: *Maybe just forget* the whole making the how-to documentation then you *remember* that you where a "*wiki-markup guru*" and make the list by /+insert -> *wiki-markup*.

{code}

## You start by creating a table "*Table*" -> You *select 2x4 table*, *WOOSH!* That was quick.. oh wait what's that bullet in front of the table? I'll just remove it so it looks more professional. Oh there is an extra line also let's delete that as well. Now let's punch up the numbers.. *done!* .. good everything *seems* ok.. now let's *continue* the numbered list so the next should bee... "*c.*" alright.. *Press enter* after the table, hmm.. ok? it brought you an *empty line*. Let's just try to *out-dent* the line. \*Click\* AARHG it out-dented the *bullet* that was *above* the table and it converted it to *numbered list*!?
## And you *spend hours*(which you could have used to make the page complete)of *fixing* a *single* document when you *finally* realize that you could just do it with *wiki markup*.

I really don't "know" the *solution* but when *using lists* in *rich-text* it really raises *few gray hairs*. *AND* if you didn't *use* pre *Confluence 4.0* or didn't know wiki-markup.. You just *couldn't* do decent looking lists.

The confluence-rest-plugin has a rest resource to look up "non-system" users which takes in a username. If given username supplied is not found then it is included in an xml error message without being xml encoded and thus is a XSS vector. That is, < > and other such xml special characters are not encoded.

However, I am unable to exploit the issue as if a "/" is found anywhere in the the "username" portion of the url then the resource is not mapped (the url no longer is mapped to the non-system user rest resource).

[Reported by Jean-François Bouchard|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+4.3+Release+Notes?focusedCommentId=301662312#comment-301662312]

{quote}
I'm having some troubles with the draggable images and macros feature; clicking on images or non-box macros to simply edit them seems impossible now, as it'll just pick up and move the image/macro around. Anyone has a tip to go around that?

Is there any way to disable that specific feature? Maybe an option in the user settings in the next update? I personally find Cut/Paste was and still is the perfect way to move things around, but I've never been fond of WYSIWYG, so that might just be me.
{quote}

----
Essentially the activation for dragging an image or macro placeholder is currently too sensitive, and can activate when clicking the mouse, and the mouse moves 1 pixel while clicking (not uncommon with mice).

Fixed by requiring a minimum mouse movement before dragging activates, otherwise normal click behaviour will occur.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26575].
  {panel}

One of the most powerful aspects of Confluence is its email notification of new and changed content. This topic has been discussed in Confluence forums since at least 2006, but no significant action has been taken by Atlassian except for renaming the "Minor change" box to "Notify watchers." I still haven't seen any posting that summarizes the issues as my wiki users and I see them. This is an update to http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257301891.

The problem is that users receive too many email notifications that most people consider unhelpful at best and very annoying at worst. The control mechanisms currently available in Confluence are inadequate to control sending email notifications, and "watch" options available to users can not make up for this deficiency.

We can divide actions and content into new, edited and removed pages, comments, news, and attachments as summarized below:

Content Type	New	Edited	Removed
Page	-	X	-
Comment	-	-	-
News/blog	-	-	-
Attachment	-	-	-


The X shows the only option, as far as I can tell, for preventing sending email notifications.

Per this chart, email notifications are automatically sent out for ALL combinations EXCEPT for edited pages based on whether users check the "Notify watchers" option box. This same box could easily be made available for editing comments and blog entries and adding or removing attachments. (Searching Confluence forums for "minor change" provides several conversations on this matter back at least to 2006.) 

We find particularly annoying email notifications resulting from removing or moving content. As administrator, I have removed pages, comments, and attachments as inappropriate or obsolete and have almost certainly not wanted to bring attention to that removed content. I also move pages, frequently to archival folders, and the only way to prevent email alerting messages from blasting users is to turn off the email function as an administrator. Using WebDAV to move or remove entries generates email blizzards.

We also believe email notifications about attachments (added, moved, or removed) to be of very low value. Attachments are almost always supporting or described by the page content itself which will be the subject of its own email notification.

My users and I believe it is past time for Atlassian to provide users and administrators better control in Confluence over sending these email notifications. This includes, but is not limited to, improving the "Notify watchers" option with clear option buttons or similar mechanisms as discussed in other forum entries.

I look forward to elaboration of this issue by other users and action by Atlassian on this matter.
fields.summary: Better control of email notifications for new, changed, and removed content

According to the description in {{/confluence/template/includes/macros.vm}}, this is what {{blogPostsCalendarWithDateLinks}} is about: {quote} Passes in the action and a flag to display the correct arrow links to blogs: _true_ = link to the next/prev DATE post, with blog post date displayed _false_ = link to the next/prev post, with blog post title displayed {quote} But setting the arrow links to false does not display the arrow at all. E.g. {{#blogPostsCalendarWithDateLinks($helper.action, false)}}. There is a bug in the code in {{macros.vm}}: {noformat} #if ($action.nextPost || $action.previousPost) #if ($permissionHelper.canView($action.remoteUser, $action.nextDatePost) ) .... #end #if ($permissionHelper.canView($action.remoteUser, $action.previousDatePost) ) .... #end
#end {noformat} should be changed to: {noformat} #if ($action.nextPost || $action.previousPost) #if ($permissionHelper.canView($action.remoteUser, $action.nextPost) ) .... #end #if ($permissionHelper.canView($action.remoteUser, $action.previousPost) ) .... #end
#end {noformat} i.e. {{$action.nextDatePost}} should be changed to {{$action.nextPost}} and {{$action.previousDatePost}} should be changed to {{$action.previousPost}} *Steps to reproduce* * Create a number of blog posts * In *Space Admin > Layouts > Blog Post Layout > Edit/Create Custom*, add {{#blogPostsCalendarWithDateLinks($helper.action, false)}} after {{}} line * Go to a blog post page and the arrow is not displayed. *Workaround* Change the code in {{/confluence/template/includes/macros.vm}} as instructed above

fields.description:
When receiving emails from Confluence, 2 strange attachments are added to the mail, (see screenshot attached). This behaviour only occurs in *Lotus Notes and Apple Mail* and cannot be reproduced in Thunderbird or through a Webmail client.


h5. Lotus Notes
The issue can occur when the "Keep in sender's format" option is selected in the Person document in the Domino Directory. Changing this to "Prefer MIME" resolves the issue. This can however lead to undesirable layouts from other email sources.

The issue may also occur because of preferences in the client. In the client, go to File -> Preferences -> User Preferences, and untick 'Show inline MIME images as attachments'. This can be done to all clients through [a notes.ini variable pushed through a policy document|http://blog.tomcat2000.com/blog/tomcat2000.nsf/dx/enable-show-in-line-mime-images-as-attachments-via-policies.htm?opendocument&comments].

fields.description:
*Problem Description*
Email template doesn't adapt the language, when inviting user to Confluence and the instance is configured to use other language. Confluence should detect the language and send the appropriate email template to the invited user. This behaviour seems to be controlled by easyuser plugin.

*Step to reproduce*
# [Setup simple mail server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=42795030]
# Change language to other bundled language, for example German.
# Change the browser language to German if the default is not German.
# Navigate to Admin Console in Confluence to check that Confluence has changed its language.
# [Send an invitation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Adding+and+Inviting+Users#AddingandInvitingUsers-Invitingpeopletosignup] to user through e-mail
# Check the received mail

*Workaround*
# Navigate to {{<confluence install>/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/setup}}
# Open {{atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip}}
# Look for {{confluence-easyuser-admin-4.2.5.jar}} and open it
# Navigate to {{/com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/easyuser/}}
# Open {{i18n.properties}}
# Find the relevant text and replace it with the desired language
fields.summary: Language is not adapted on template when inviting user from e-mail

fields.description:
The Confluence installer appears to not detect modifications to server.xml

For our deployment of Confluence Standalone on Linux, we have it running behind a proxy server out of a subdirectory on our domain. As such, we have a modified server.xml that changes the port, sets the proxy domain name and port, and sets the root directory.

Upgrading Confluence via the installer catches other modified or unrecognized files, but does not appear to recognize changes to server.xml and, as such, we are forced to manually updated server.xml each time.
fields.summary: Confluence installer does not detect modifications to server.xml
